io.sphere.sdk.models

Class Money

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.models.Money

  • @Immutable
public class Money
extends java.lang.Object
    Money represented by amount and currency.
    The precision is whole cents. Fractional cents can't be represented and amounts will always be rounded to nearest cent value when performing calculations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Money

        public Money(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
             java.lang.String currencyCode)
        Creates a new Money instance. Money can't represent cent fractions. The value will be rounded to nearest cent value using RoundingMode.HALF_EVEN.
        Parameters:
        amount - the money value as fraction, e.g. 43.21 will be 4321 cents.
        currencyCode - the ISO 4217 currency code

    • Method Detail

        public static Money fromCents(long centAmount,
                              java.lang.String currencyCode)

      • getAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getAmount()
        The exact amount as BigDecimal, useful for implementing e.g. custom rounding / formatting methods.
        Returns:
        the amount as decimal number

      • getCentAmount

        public long getCentAmount()

      • getCurrencyCode

        public java.lang.String getCurrencyCode()
        Returns:
        The ISO 4217 currency code, for example "EUR" or "USD".

      • plus

        public Money plus(Money amount)
        Returns a new Money instance that is a sum of this instance and given instance.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount which should be added to this amount
        Returns:
        a new money instance

      • multiply

        public Money multiply(double multiplier,
                      java.math.RoundingMode roundingMode)
        Returns a new Money instance that has the amount multiplied by given factor. Rounding may be necessary to round fractional cents to the nearest cent value.
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the factor to multiply with
        roundingMode - the rounding mode
        Returns:
        the new money instance

      • multiply

        public Money multiply(double multiplier)
        Returns a new Money instance that has the amount multiplied by given factor. Fractional cents will be rounded to the nearest cent value using Banker's rounding algorithm (RoundingMode.HALF_EVEN).
        Parameters:
        multiplier - the factor to multiply with
        Returns:
        the new money instance

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(int decimalPlaces)
        Formats the amount to given number of decimal places.
        Example: price.format(2) => "3.50"
        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces - number of the decimal places to display
        Returns:
        formatted money output without the currency
